question: Find the (1, 0) entry of $\alpha \mathbf{A}$, where \begin{align*} \alpha = 3 && A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ -3 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that scalar multiplication involves multiplying each entry by the scalar.

question: Find the (2, 2) entry of $\beta \mathbf{C}$, where \begin{align*} \beta = -2 && C = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 \\ 2 & 3 & 0 \\ -1 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Note that these questions use zero-based indexing.
Incorrect. Recall that scalar multiplication involves multiplying each entry by the scalar.
